p: We next performed a histological analysis by performing H&E staining. As shown in Figures 4(a) and 4(b), 4% DSS treatment induced an inflammatory response that affected colonic architecture, cell infiltration, crypt shortening or loss, and goblet cell depletion. Administration of Combretin A (50 mg/kg), Combretin B (50 mg/kg), and prednisolone (4 mg/kg) significantly reduced the number of infiltrating cells, mucosal injury, and bleeding.
